developmental_risk_block.text: Developmental risk is flagged due to limited adolescent data and uncertain long-term effects. Endocrine, growth, neurodevelopmental, and metabolic setpoints may be sensitive to perturbation. This section is descriptive only; uncertainty is explicitly acknowledged.

changelog.detail: Generated from queue ingestion (Phase 6). Requires human-authored, evidence-bounded content.

practical.bottom_line: Orexin-A (hypocretin-1) is a brain peptide central to wakefulness and arousal regulation. Human use outside research is high-risk; sleep, anxiety, and cardiovascular symptoms can be meaningful.
benefits: physiology relevance in wakefulness and sleep-wake stability (narcolepsy biology)
research relevance in arousal, motivation, and appetite-related circuitry
side_effects_serious: severe anxiety, agitation, or panic symptoms
chest pain, fainting, or severe shortness of breath
severe allergic reaction symptoms (hives, facial swelling, trouble breathing)
who_should_be_cautious: people with insomnia, panic disorder, or severe anxiety history
people with cardiovascular disease or uncontrolled blood pressure
people taking stimulants or other CNS-active prescriptions
adolescents (neurodevelopment uncertainty plus limited human evidence)
